seo.h1_title: Southern Thailand Deep South: Coastal Roads to Malaysian Border
seo.intro_paragraph: Follow the coast from Prachuap and its calm bays, then enter Khao Sok amid emerald lakes and cliffs. Continue to Krabi, limestone terrain and boat-accessible coves, before reaching Koh Libong where the island keeps a discreet rhythm. In the deep south, Thai Muslim culture adds another color to the route.
seo.seo_hook: Limestone giants guarding emerald waters, dugongs drifting through seagrass meadows, mosque calls in border towns. Southern Thailand, secret.
featured_list: Khao Sok: jungle lake floating dreams

seo.h1_title: Thailand Ultimate Itinerary: Bangkok, Chiang Mai, Phuket & Islands
seo.intro_paragraph: Enter Bangkok through Wat Pho, between incense and reclining Buddha, then head to Ayutthaya and its root-entwined ruins. Reach Chiang Mai and its hilltop temples, before diving at Koh Tao among corals. End at Koh Phangan, where night comes alive by the water and changes the pace.
seo.seo_hook: Golden spires piercing humid sky, jungle temples guarding secrets, coral gardens shimmering beneath longtail shadows. Thailand, endless enchantment.
featured_list: Bangkok: temple gold, street food fire
Chiang Mai: mountain temples, elephant sanctuary
Koh Tao: diving paradise, coral gardens
Koh Phangan: full moon, beach energy

seo.h1_title: Thailand's Essential Route: Temples of Ayutthaya, Chiang Rai & Krabi
seo.intro_paragraph: Explore Bangkok between glittering temples and street food, then head up to Chiang Rai and its disconcerting White Temple. Take time in Chiang Mai, between markets and misty hills, before reaching Khao Sok and its dense jungle. Finish in the Gulf islands, clear waters and soft beaches, to let the sea close the journey.
seo.seo_hook: Golden spires piercing humid skies, incense curling through sanctuaries, turquoise waters lapping shores. Thailand, from mountain to sea.
featured_list: Chiang Mai: mountain temples night markets
Khao Sok: jungle limestone lake magic
Koh Tao: diving paradise turquoise waters

itineraries.title: ULTIMATE NORTHERN THAILAND ROAD TRIP: TEMPLES, TRIBES AND MOUNTAIN LANDSCAPES

visits.text: Visit Wat Phra That Doi Suthep, a hilltop temple with panoramic views and ornate Lanna-style architecture.
Walk through Chiang Mai Old City and admire temples such as Wat Chedi Luang and Wat Phra Singh.

activities.text: Join a local family in a traditional Lanna-style home to prepare and share a Khantoke dinner.

visits.text: Explore Doi Inthanon National Park, Thailand’s highest peak, with forest trails and waterfalls like Wachirathan and Siriphum.

activities.text: Trek the Kew Mae Pan Nature Trail for breathtaking views and lush vegetation.

visits.text: Stop at Bua Tong Field at Doi Mae Ou Kor to see wild sunflowers in bloom during November and December.
Visit Wat Phra That Doi Kong Mu for panoramic views of Mae Hong Son and surrounding mountains.
Explore Wat Chong Kam and Wat Chong Klang, twin Burmese-style temples beside a serene lake.

activities.text: Browse Mae Hong Son’s night market and discover colorful hill-tribe handicrafts.

visits.text: Walk across Su Tong Pae Bridge, the longest bamboo bridge in Thailand, and make a wish for good fortune.
Discover the lakeside village of Ban Rak Thai surrounded by mountains and tea plantations.

activities.text: Relax at Phu Klon Country Club Health Mud Spa for a mineral-rich mud treatment and aromatherapy massage.
Taste premium local teas like Ching and Oolong in Ban Rak Thai village.

visits.text: Explore Tham Nam Lot, Thailand’s largest cave system, filled with impressive stalactites and stalagmites.
Visit Pai Canyon (Kong Laen) to admire dramatic cliffs and sunset views.
Watch the sunrise from Yun-Lai Viewpoint for breathtaking views of the Pai Valley.

activities.text: Stroll through Pai’s lively night market and try authentic northern Thai street food.

visits.text: Drive back to Chiang Mai with scenic stops in mountain villages.

activities.text: Enjoy a farewell dinner in Chiang Mai’s Old Town.

seo.h1_title: Northern Thailand Motorbike Loop: Chiang Mai, Pai & Mae Hong Son
seo.intro_paragraph: Start in Chiang Mai, then climb toward Doi Inthanon and its altitude mists. Take the road to Mae Hong Son, remote valley and changing landscapes, then stop at Ban Rak Thai for the spirit of tea and hills. End in Pai, between bohemian cafés, canyon in low sun and hot springs, perfect for releasing pressure.
seo.seo_hook: Mountain roads winding through mist, tribal villages clinging to green ridges, tea plantations carpeting slopes. Northern Thailand rewards explorers.
featured_list: Doi Inthanon: highest peak royal pagodas
Mae Hong Son: remote valley Burmese temples
Ban Rak Thai: tea village Chinese heritage
Pai: canyon cafes hot springs bohemia
